title: Good Morning Faithful Volunteers
content:
Good Morning Ace Volunteers,

For several weeks, Thunderbird crashes when I try to open letters with attachments and each time I try adding attachments to my outgoing letters. Every time.

On incoming mail with an attachment, I don't get a glimpse of the letter, let alone read the attachment. Instant shutdown. The preview pane doesn't display when there's an attachment.

Just now, I spent a good 15 minutes trying my best to access what a friend wrote, knowing the attachment wouldn't open. Though I tried every trick in the book, each effort led to an instant shutdown of Thunderbird. Never saw a word of it, just the subject line.

Stubborn me has been trying to diagnose and fix the problem when I could seek a solution from fellow Thunderbird users. It's time to ask for help from DemWhoWhat can fix this problem.

My sign-in email address for my Mozilla account is jiminlexky@yahoo.com. My principal email address is jiminky@windstream.net.

Thank you, guys.

Jim Deaton, aka JimInKy at Mozilla Lexington, Kentucky
creator: jiminlexky

title: Suddenly not receving all my mails, plus at some time receiving duplicate ones.
content:
I've been using Thunderbird on my Mac Pro (TB 102.11.0 64-bit) and recently some, but not all my messages are being downloaded. I could see that a few were on my server ok, but TB was just not downloading them all. Any hints on how to solve this?

Also as of some months ago, I also sometimes receive duplicate mails. I'm cautious about changing my profile because in the past when I tried some suggested problem solutions, I ended up losing a lot of mail which was a serious problem.

Thanks in advance for anyone who can help me through this...
creator: superial

title: Change from W10 to Mabox(Manjaro) Linux
content:
I use TB with W10. Mails are stored in a separate Folder in Partition F:/film_mail I now want to work with TB in Mabox Linux and installed it (102.11.0). I backed the profile data I found in the W10 user directory. Maybe I carry some ballast since I use it a long time with different versions.

Here is the profile.ini from W10:

[Install8216C80C92C4E828] Default=F: ilm_mail Locked=1

[Profile3] Name=default-release-1 IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/vf8qu6ib.default-release-1

[Profile2] Name=film_mail IsRelative=0 Path=F: ilm_mail

[InstallD78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=F: ilm_mail Locked=1

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/m04wafv4.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/ofh9vmya.default-release

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

When I try to import this into TB, the error console says

Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at /run/media/datacine/Data_Df/Thunderbird_Profile/prefs.js

I did search for this file and it is included in my folder F: ilm_mail. I tried to do the import on this folder and get: NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED: Component returned failure code: 0x8052000b (NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED) [mozIStorageStatement.executeStep]

Uncaught (in promise) Exception { name: "NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED", message: "Component returned failure code: 0x8052000b (NS_ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED) [mozIStorageStatement.executeStep]", result: 2152857611, filename: "resource:///modules/SQLiteDirectory.jsm", lineNumber: 239, columnNumber: 0, data: null, stack: "get cards@resource:///modules/SQLiteDirectory.jsm:239:32 get childCards@resource:///modules/AddrBookDirectory.jsm:300:1 _importSqliteFile@resource:///modules/AddrBookFileImporter.jsm:313:24 ", location: XPCWrappedNative_NoHelper }

How to import my settings from a Windows10 installation?
creator: lwx427

content:
I print several e-mails once a month. I haven't tried to print from Thunderbird since last month when it successfully printed last. I have never encountered this issue in the several years I have owned this computer.

I'm using Thunderbird 114.0b3 on MacOS Monterey 12.6.5 on an M1 Mac Mini.

None of the other programs on my computer are having this issue.

I open up Thunderbird & try to print & nothing happens. The printer window does not appear at all.

I tried saving the email as an eml and as a text file. I works but skews the information.

I receive no error messages of any kind.

Today's date is 5/29/2023
creator: crackerjackaz

title: Spam filtered out before instead of after manual filter
content:
I am part of an email list in which many emails come in everyday. That is why I created a sub-folder in Thunderbird for them, and created a manual filter so that all emails with the email-list's address as addressee are redirected to that sub-folder. I do want to be able to receive all the emails that go to that email list, just in this separate folder, so that it doesn't crowd out my other emails. I set the settings to "filter before Junk classification" and I also put that filter on top of all the filters.

I just realized that many many of the emails to that email list landed in the spam folder instead. The addressee is exactly as stated in my manual filter. It is explicitly set to FIRST go through my manual filter before they can be classified as spam. If Thunderbird did what it says it does, none of these emails should land in the spam folder, because filtered out by my manual filter before.

Does anyone know why this happens, and how to prevent it?
creator: isabelkaeslin

title: En ciertos momentos Thunderbird deja de bajar correos de Gmail
content: Mi consulta es la siguiente, tengo configurada una cuenta de Google en Thunderbird, tiene su OAuth2 y funciona perfecto. Pero pasado un tiempo aleatorio deja de funcionar y no conecta al imap. La única solución que he encontrado es eliminar la cuenta y volverla a crear, y comienza a funcionar nuevamente, pero resulta bastante incómodo eliminar la cuenta cada vez que deja de sincronizar. Podrían ayudarme? Muchas gracias! Alicia
creator: aydencomunicacion

title: Thunderbird + mobile not syncing properly (Outlook 365)
content:
Hi,

I hope there is one kind soul out there that are able to help me resolve this issue for a user in my organization. This is the last resort as I've been doing quiet a lot of testing to get this sorted out.

Case: - Using Outlook 365 - Have successfully added the e-mail to Thunderbird through IMAP settings - I can successfully send and receive e-mail on both desktop and mobile (using Spark on iOS)

Problem: - When I send an e-mail on desktop, it is added to "Sent" folder on mobile. - HOWEVER, the issue is when sending an e-mail from Spark (iOS), it is not seen on the "Sent" folder on desktop where Thunderbird is used. What could be the cause of this happening?

What I've tried: - Testing a lot of different settings. This is the only settings where we can both send and receive e-mail on: IMAP: outlook.office365.com / SSL TLS / OAuth2 / Port 993. SMTP: smtp.office365.com / Port 587 / OAuth2 / STARTTLS - Removing and adding account more than 10+ times - Made sure, under "Synchronization and Storage" in TB, that the top checkbox is checked (Keep all messages in all folders for this account on this computer)

I might also tell you that syncing works perfectly for everyone else, however, they are using Outlook on both mobile and desktop and using the office 365 login option. Which Thunderbird does not have.

Anyone have any ideas on what I could test or try in order for iOS and Thunderbird to sync sent msgs properly? That is, sending emails from Spark on iPhone and getting them to the Sent folder in Thunderbird on desktop.
creator: alexander85

title: Thunderbird doesn't respect my default browser setting, and tries to open with Firefox but fails
content:
Instead of respecting my settings for default/preferred browser (in Linux, both in XFCE and KDE desktops) settings and instead tries to open in Firefox - which is not exactly wrong, as that is my preferred browser, *however* I've set my preferred browser to be a shell script called "firefox-open.sh" that runs the following code:

  1. !/bin/sh

firefox -P default-release "$@"

That's because I have two firefox profiles, and just setting my default browser to Firefox results in error message that says: "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To open a new window, you must first close the existing Firefox process, or restart your system."

When I click on a link on Thunderbird, the same message pops out. All the rest of the applications I use respect my default browser setting, either directly following the settings, or by calling "exo-open" to open the URL, which in turn opens in my default browser. If Thunderbird used either method, it would open the links nicely in a new window.

This problem occurs on my CentOS 7 system. I know I should switch away from CentOS 7, as it's now a dead distribution. CentOS Stream exists, but it's not the same CentOS distribution and the old ones can't be upgraded to it. Because of this I'm using an outdated version of Thunderbird - I know that, and maybe upgrading it would solve the issue; however I *can't* right now, and I don't know why it does this anyway. My version of Thunderbird is 102.7.1, and I'd love to receive an answer for how I could either make it respect my default browser, or simply configure the command it uses to open link in browser - I could then just configure it to use either my script or the exo-open command, but I see no option for that in the settings, anywhere.

It's quite baffling that both the browser and the email client are from Mozilla, yet it's the only application I'm having trouble getting to open the links in Firefox correctly ;) I hope someone can advice me - other than to upgrade (believe me, I will do that just as soon as I can).
creator: robsku
